subject: Medicine
title: Superspreader Events
description: A micro-lesson that makes Superspreader Events usable.

hook.text: One church choir practice infected 52 of 61 members with COVID-19 in two hours. Most outbreaks have a few key events.

buildup.text: Superspreader events occur when one person or gathering infects far more people than the average.

discovery.text: About 10â€“20% of infected people cause 80% of transmission. Most people infect nobody at all.

twist.text: Indoor, crowded, poorly ventilated spaces are the recipe for superspreadingâ€”not the individual.

climax.text: Targeting high-risk settings is far more effective than restricting everyone equally.

punchline.text: Pandemics spread in bursts, not in steady streams.

quiz.question: What characterizes superspreader events?
options: A small number of people or gatherings cause most transmission
